abstract: City of Cleveland continues to refuse to pay former inmate David Ayers, who was wrongfully imprisoned for 12 years, $13.2 million awarded to him in 2013 by federal grand jury; city claims responsibility lies with two homicide detectives that convicted him.
lead_paragraph: The Ohio city says it owes nothing to a man whose murder conviction was voided in 2010 and was later awarded $13.2 million by a federal jury. The city insists the judgment was against two homicide detectives.

headline.main: Cleveland Is Accused of ‘Blatant Dodge’ for Not Paying After Verdicts
headline.print_headline: Cleveland Is Accused of ‘Blatant Dodge’ for Not Paying After Verdicts

snippet: The Ohio city says it owes nothing to a man whose murder conviction was voided in 2010 and was later awarded $13.2 million by a federal jury. The city insists the judgment was against two homicide detectives.
